postings.body:
**Absolutely Sept 1st move into a house a must, possibly a large condo or town house! Rent is between $850 - $1000 per room.
**I am not married to any specific location, but willing to check out other good living solutions in Weho, Hollywood, Los Feliz, Echo Park, NoHo, and anywhere north of 10 freeway.
**We shall view several agreeable properties that meets our wish lists.
** FYI, I have a full modern and retro furniture collection to cover most share areas. Can get rid pieces if need be!
What I am looking for in a roommate:
- Mid 20`s to 40`s, Prefer gay or bi male dude, may consider str8 dude. Female and couples OK.
- Must have verifiable employment and pay rent on time. Locals prefer who has acclimated to L.A., people with big city attitude is a plus
- Prefer cool, creative, and intelligent people!
- No stranger attitude! Sociable personality that gets alone with most people is a plus. where we can have movie nights, Saturday BBQ, Sunday Brunch, and going out to cool places and events. Friday`s - group sex, just kidding!
- I am interested in rooming with people who are sexually very free. So gay roommate prefer, not a must!
- Must be very very clean, neat, organized, and not leaving things all over the place in share areas
- Prefer mature attitude, considerate, easy to live with, fair head on their shoulder, straight shooter, and very very cool liberal minded people.
- Not looking for constant party people at home, but am open to having friends gathering with happy times. Responsible recreational drug O.K. after all, we do live in party central, but let`s not have cops knocking at our door man!
About me:
- Very liberal minded, progressive thinking, upscale disposition, and groovy trendsetting professional, creative, and artist type, partial type A personality, spiritual person, urban minded, very Americanized gay Asian Male, 41 y.o. (looks and act between 28 - 32 as I always get told). Originally from Malaysia, grew up in suburban of Houston, and attended College in Chicago. Been in L.A. for over 10 yrs. I am single, mostly dating, and am in the quest for a husband. I got a couple of mostly outdoor cats and indoor cats!
I am a professional architectural designer and interior architect, including backgrounds in architecture, landscape design, custom furniture/lighting design, graphic/web design, at presently, focusing on establishing a self-own multidisciplinary design firm. I make $40/hr with a design firm and $85.00/hr with my own clients! at the moment, mostly working from home until renting outside office is necessary for me!
Tentatively speaking, I am also in the process of partnering with someone to opening up a film production company. Will see where that takes me!
I am also a multi-medium fine artist into many forms of art and photography. Also presently trying to built my resume through showing my works in upscale commercial galleries.
If I am not doing any of the above, I maybe sewing and fashion designing a garment. My aspiration is to put out a fashion collections for mass market consumer.
To add to that, while living with me, you may hear me training my voice and working on my acting skills as I just recently became a working actor trying to become SAG-aftra and getting an agent rep.
In short, I am aspiring creative and entrepreneur trying to nail down my business before going back to graduate school to become a film director at AFI. Yea, I am pretty much the bomb, just kidding!
Naw, just trying my hardest to make a great life for myself for the future, as I do enjoy the luxury lifestyle and being pamper living atop of Hollywood Hill with hot boys servicing me!!!
I am mature, friendly, considerate, somewhat easy going, and straight shooter/clear communicator. Mostly clean, neat, and organize person. Sometime chilled, laid back, and have not a care in the world. Can sometime be bitchy! Oh, on occasion, crazy weird and dangerously wild, flamboyant, and party it up! Afternoon all, we do live in L.A. playground! Mostly I am dedicated to my passion and career!
When responding:
Be detailed and thorough, tell me about yourself and your situation, include a face pic or Facebook and phone number.
Do not apply if:
-- If you got lot of personal hang ups about things. Dumb and stupid with people!
-- Constantly negative, angry at the world, rude, hater, dirty, or people that just don`t get it!
-- No codependent, over needy personality, Jackal and Hyde mood swings.
-- People who likes to create unnecessary drama, project their insecurities on other people, or people who constantly get shit happening to them (ya know the shit out of luck people). However, the delicious and good drama can stay!
USC, downtown, Westlake, West Hollywood, Hollywood, Silverlake, Echo Park, Miracle Miles, Los feliz, Universal City, Beverly Hills, Bel Air, and Hollywood Hills.

postings.body:
Hey!
We`re a bunch of super friendly and easy going folk ranging from 22-30. Three guys, two gals.
It`s a two level full house with 3 bedrooms and 1 bathroom on the upper floor, and 3 bedrooms and 1 bathroom on the lower level. Two kitchens, two dining areas, two living rooms, two wood burning fireplaces. Two awesome dogs. Washer and dryer and a dishwasher as well :)
Available for AUGUST 1st are two of the basement bedrooms. One is 200sqf for $500, the other is 110sqf for $400. Utilities and Cable/Internet are extra and split equally (roughly $30-60/mo depending on the time of year).
Currently there are no photos as the rooms are still occupied, but we`ll have photos up soon :)
We have a MAAAAASSIVE back yard. Lots of big beautiful trees, a huge deck that wraps around the side of the house, a paved area for ball hockey or basketball or whatever, garden space begging to be used, and a 4 car driveway with ample street parking.
The house is a 2 minute walk from Lake City Way Skytrain, and right off Lougheed Highway and Philips. 15 minute drive to BCIT, 25 min drive to Downtown Vancouver. Loads of restaurants and shopping in the area. Friendly neighbours.
If you`re interested, please send us an email letting us know a bit about yourself. Ideally we`d like to find someone in our age group (20-30) who`s employed, responsible, clean, and chill.
No pets sorry, we`re already at capacity and one of us is allergic :(
Cheers!

postings.body:
Hi! I am moving out of my current sublet August 8th and need someone to fill my room until Sept 1st. At that point the lease will become month to month and you`ll have the option to continue renting until at least the end of Dec.
Rent is $1305/month plus ~$80 for utilities.
The room is big, gets great natural light, and there are 2 bathrooms so you only share a bathroom with one other person. You would have 3 other roommates (all awesome girls in their mid-twenties), washer/dryer, backyard, garage for storage, and an incredible view of the Golden Gate Bridge from the kitchen window! You are 3 blocks away from Fisherman`s Wharf and Fort Mason and super close to all of the great bars/restaurants on Polk St. If you have a car there is plenty of street parking. I also currently have one of the parking spots in the garage which is available for an additional $150/month.
The small caveat is that my room is a converted living room with sliding doors that lead into the master so one roommate and her (adorable/quiet/hypoallergenic) dog will walk through occasionally. It has not been a privacy issue at all this year and definitely won`t be for such a small amount of time! As you can see in the pictures, the kitchen is big enough to fit two couches and serves as great communal space.
Please reply if you are interested and include a little bit about yourself. A link to your Facebook profile would be helpful and will speed up the process. I will get back to you as soon as possible and we can hopefully set up a time this week for you to view the room!

postings.body:
Hi there, my name is Alyssa and I am looking to find someone who is looking for a roommate or is wanting to move out soon, within a few months or sooner depending on the price, and if it feels right. I`ve posted before but haven`t really found anyone who is really committed. I`m interested in Vancouver or the northern side of Portland.
I am very clean, friendly, respectful, trustworthy and hardworking. I am 22, and would like to move out with someone around the same age that has the same traits listed. I`ve been in search for a roommate the past few months and I would like to either find someone who would like to move out, so we can make the place our own. Or find someone who would like to have a wonderful roommate like me! I am willing to spend about $400 - $550 for rent. Preferably including utilities.
I`m not a cat person, but I love dogs. I like to go out, meet new people, but I also like to stay home or go to the gym on my days off too. I work very hard as a server. Don`t worry about house parties, that`s not my style, but I do like to occasionally have my close friends over to play games.
I do smoke, but only outside. If you smoke that`s fine, just outside please. Cooking is one of my favorite things to do so if you can dig it or help that`s wonderful! I am LGBT friendly, my two best friends are gay so I hope you`re comfortable with it. And I don`t do 420, I don`t care if you do but just not out of control making our house smell like Hemp Fest 24/7.
Like I said earlier, I am very trustworthy, I am willing to share what I have as long as it is a two way street. I tend to keep to myself for the most part, I`m always busy so please don`t mind me always coming and going. I`m always down to hangout with a roomie though!
If you`re not into this whole reading about me thing and would like to meet me in person, if I am interested we can always go grab dinner or drinks to really get to know each other. I think that`s best personally. Let me know! Email me :)
PS - I am really busy, and do not have the best wifi connection. So if it takes me a day or two to get back to you don`t be offended.

postings.body:
We are two Harvard undergraduates with a beautiful apartment lined up for September 1st, and are looking for 3 roommates to sign a 1-year lease with us. The apartment is in a 4-unit building on a quiet side street in Harvard Square, just minutes from the Red Line and the 66 and 86 bus routes, as well as 30 seconds from shopping and eating on Brattle St. Total rent is $5500 monthly, but will be divided up per person based on the size of the room that each person chooses. Broker fee is $5500, and will be divided up similarly. Utilities are not included, but are about $100 a month per person. The apartment is currently furnished as seen in the photos, but once the current occupants move out you will need to furnish your rooms yourself.
A little bit about us:
One of us is a rising senior studying physics and philosophy. He grew up in Cambridge and is very familiar with the area. His interests included bicycling, jazz and classical piano, and Zen.
The other is a rising junior studying statistics, born and raised in Finland but in the US for the foreseeable future. His interests include guitar, minimalism, Finnish hip-hop, and foreign languages.
Both of us are serious students who also know how to have a good time. Ideal roommates would , like us, enjoy living a balanced lifestyle that combines peace and quiet with much-needed blowing off steam. We are not neat freaks, but like to keep a clean and uncluttered house. It`s totally fine if you want to do your own thing and not join us in socializing, but don`t be surprised if we have people over from time to time--and feel to do so yourself.

postings.body:
I have a room available for rent in a 4 bedroom house. The room shares a 2 sink bathroom with 2 other roommates. Rent includes all utilities including tv and internet. The term is month to month.
The mates:
My name is Kent. I`m 25 years old, single, and work full time. Originally from LA, graduated from UofA in 2010 and about to finish my MBA from GCU. In high school you would have considered me the class clown. I love joking around, hanging out, and having fun. Love cooking, trying new things, and always down for an adventure or anything to pump my adrenaline. Easy to get along with. I`m somewhat intelligent and can hold a conversation quite well. I`m 420 friendly and love winding down with a delicious drink.
Chris is 23 years old, has a girlfriend (she`s cool), and also works full time. He is from a small town in northern California near San Francisco and graduated from MMI 2 years ago specializing in motorcycle mechanics. Spends a lot of time in the garage and is quite handy with his hands. Not much of a beer drinker but always down for a shot. He is outgoing, friendly, and also very easy to talk to.
Lastly is DJ. DJ just moved into the house about a month ago. He is 25, from Georgia, and recently graduated from Georgia Tech. He was a long distance runner in college and, believe me, he can run. He`s very social and easy to get along with.
The house:
The house includes a pool table, bar, 60" flatscreen tv w/ soundbar, pool, misters, outdoor speakers, bbq, granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, and a cool ass mutt named Moby. The term is month to month with a $250 refundable security deposit. Please give me a call or text with your name, age, and any questions you have and please let me know a little about yourself
 show contact info
 As I may get several responses please allow us at least 24 hours upon meeting you to make our final decisions. We want to find mates with the right chemistry.
Thank you,
Kent (if you would like to look me up on facebook my name is Kent Wienzveg)
Thank you for your time and happy house hunting!
